about.paragraph4: Maritime Pilot Officers have contributed greatly to Indonesia's maritime safety for commercial and non-commercial vessels entering/leaving ports in Indonesia, including other waters that require safe, secure, efficient, and effective sailing services. These activities are closely related to Indonesia's competitiveness in the maritime sector and its decline in activity.
about.paragraph5: Since 2017, INAMPA has been a member of the International Maritime Pilots' Association (IMPA), which is a strategic partner of the IMO (International Maritime Organization), a UN agency that oversees global maritime safety with approximately 185 member countries.

visi.title: Vision
visi.text: Working together to do something better.

misi.title: Mission
misi.text1: 1. Enhancing the competence and professionalism of Maritime Pilot Officers through continuous education, training, certification, and development in accordance with national and international standards.
misi.text2: 2. Upholding professional ethics and integrity in every execution of pilotage duties to ensure the safety and security of navigation.
misi.text3: 3. Building strategic collaboration with the government, port authorities, shipping associations, educational institutions, and international maritime organizations to support the advancement of Indonesia's maritime sector.
misi.text4: 4. Encouraging innovation and the use of modern maritime technology in pilotage activities to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of pilotage services.
misi.text5: 5. Becoming a government partner in formulating maritime policies that prioritize the improvement of navigation safety, protection of the marine environment, and the welfare of the Pilot profession.
misi.text6: 6. Cultivating a sense of brotherhood, solidarity, and professional pride among all Indonesian Maritime Pilot Officers.

ProgramJangkaPendek.title: Short-Term Program
ProgramJangkaPendek.text1Paraghraph1: Drafting and establishing the Bylaws (AD/ART), professional code of ethics, and the central and regional organizational structure.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text1Paraghraph2: Conducting national data collection of all Indonesian maritime pilot officers.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text1Paraghraph3: Forming regional boards in major ports.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text2Paraghraph1: Organizing workshops, seminars, and basic professional pilotage training.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text2Paraghraph2: Developing an internal training curriculum based on SKKNI and IMO Standards.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text2Paraghraph3: Conducting re-certification (re-validation) for members according to competency.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text3Paraghraph1: Drafting and socializing the Maritime Pilot Officer Code of Ethics.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text3Paraghraph2: Establishing an advocacy and legal assistance team for members.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text3Paraghraph3: Raising awareness about navigational safety and professional work ethics.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text4Paraghraph1: Developing the official website and organizational information channels.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text4Paraghraph2: Publishing newsletters or internal communication media.
ProgramJangkaPendek.text4Paraghraph3: Building relationships with maritime agencies and national media.

ProgramJangkaMenengah.title: Medium-Term Program (3 Years)
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text1Paraghraph1: Establishing a Maritime Pilot Training and Professional Development Center.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text1Paraghraph2: Conducting advanced training, ship simulation, and inter-port comparative studies.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text1Paraghraph3: Forming a digital-based Continuous Professional Development (CPD) system.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text2Paraghraph1: Developing national pilotage safety operational standards.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text2Paraghraph2: Adopting navigation technology, radar simulation, and vessel tracking for pilotage activities.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text2Paraghraph3: Preparing technical recommendations for the government related to maritime safety.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text3Paraghraph1: Becoming an official partner of the Ministry of Transportation, Port Authorities, and INAMPA in pilotage affairs.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text3Paraghraph2: Cooperating with universities and maritime research institutions.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text3Paraghraph3: Actively participating in the formulation of national pilotage policies.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text4Paraghraph1: Establishing a Maritime Pilot Professional Solidarity Fund.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text4Paraghraph2: Organizing social activities and maritime service programs in coastal areas.
ProgramJangkaMenengah.text4Paraghraph3: Developing welfare, health, and insurance programs for members.

ProgramJangkaPanjang.title: Long-Term Program (5 Years)
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text1Paraghraph1: Constructing a national secretariat building and pilot activity center.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text1Paraghraph2: Developing business units or professional cooperatives to support organizational activities.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text1Paraghraph3: Implementing an organizational quality management system (ISO or equivalent).
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text2Paraghraph1: Becoming an active member of the International Maritime Pilots’ Association (IMPA) and similar organizations.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text2Paraghraph2: Increasing participation in international forums and conferences.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text2Paraghraph3: Promoting Indonesian maritime pilots as expert professionals in the global arena.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text3Paraghraph1: Encouraging research and innovation in pilotage technology to support Smart Ports and Green Ports.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text3Paraghraph2: Actively contributing to the formulation of national policies on maritime safety and efficiency.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text3Paraghraph3: Developing international-standard education and training systems for the next generation of pilots.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text4Paraghraph1: Establishing a pilot cadre development and mentoring institute.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text4Paraghraph2: Fostering a professional, ethical, and nationally minded work culture.
ProgramJangkaPanjang.text4Paraghraph3: Affirming the maritime pilot profession as a strategic component in Indonesia’s maritime sovereignty.
